analyzed: tshig bzhi po de dag ni go rims bzhin du rtsom pa dang bag chags dang lus dang rgyu mthun par reg par bya'o //
translated: Those four phrases should be understood respectively as the beginning, the habitual tendency, the body, and the natural outflow.

original: de la rtsom pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams te 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba der yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtsom pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams te 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba der yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The composition of the treatise is based on omniscience, because it arises from that and is dedicated to that.

original: sbyin pa de rgyud la bag chags su bsgo ste de phyi ma las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa de rgyud la bag chags su bsgo ste de phyi ma las thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That generosity is imprinted as a predisposition in the mind, and in the future it becomes omniscience.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: When that is fully perfected, then omniscience is fully obtained in the manner of the full accomplishment of the Dharma body.

original: de'i 'og tu longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku rgyu mthun pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku rgyu mthun pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: After that, the enjoyment body and the emanation body perform the function of omniscience through their natural outcome.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other perfections up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: go rim gyi 'og ma 'og ma la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: go rim gyi 'og ma 'og ma la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the latter are based on the former.

original: sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong bar goms pas lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod kyi phung po chen po yang spangs nas tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin par byed do
analyzed: sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong bar goms pas lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod kyi phung po chen po yang spangs nas tshul khrims yang dag par 'dzin par byed do
translated: By the perfection of giving, the bodhisattva, who is accustomed to giving away all inner and outer things and who has no regard for body and life, gives up even a great mass of wealth and takes up morality.

original: // tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba ni gshe yang slar gshe bar mi byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba ni gshe yang slar gshe bar mi byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the protection of morality, he becomes patient, as stated in the verse: ‚ÄúEven when reviled, he does not revile in return.‚Äù

original: grang ba la sogs pa bzod pa ni de'i gzhi la sbyor ba mi nyams pas brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa bzod pa ni de'i gzhi la sbyor ba mi nyams pas brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin no //
translated: By the patience of enduring cold and so on, he becomes one who has undertaken effort, because his practice is not impaired on that basis.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sbyor ba mtha'i 'bras bu thob pas bsam gtan sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sbyor ba mtha'i 'bras bu thob pas bsam gtan sgrub pa'o //
translated: By the effort of undertaking, he becomes one who has attained the result of the culmination of practice, and thus he accomplishes meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan phun sum tshogs te sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab 'thob bo //
analyzed: bsam gtan phun sum tshogs te sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab 'thob bo //
translated: By the perfection of meditative concentration, he becomes one who has attained supramundane wisdom, because his mind, which is well-equipoised in meditative concentration, knows things as they are.

original: yang gong ma gong ma ni gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gong ma gong ma ni gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the higher perfections are the basis of the lower ones.

original: tshul khrims ni sbyin ba'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni sbyin ba'i gzhi yin no //
translated: Morality is the basis of generosity.

original: de bzhin du shes rab ni bsam gtan gyi gzhi yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab ni bsam gtan gyi gzhi yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, up to: wisdom is the basis of meditative concentration.

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sbyin bas phan btags pa'i tshul khrims kyis gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa rnam par @273a * //üîΩdag par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sbyin bas phan btags pa'i tshul khrims kyis gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa rnam par @273a * // dag par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, generosity is purified by morality, because one who possesses morality does not harm others in order to benefit them through generosity.üîΩIn this way, the bodhisattva who is a recipient should be known as one who is free from violence, and who is connected with the happiness of material things.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i len pa po so so de rnam par 'tshe ba dang bral bar yo byad kyis bde bar sbyor bas tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis sbyin pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i len pa po so so de rnam par 'tshe ba dang bral bar yo byad kyis bde bar sbyor bas tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis sbyin pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, generosity is purified by the power of morality.

original: de ltar bzod pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa dag gis bslab pa'i gzhi mi 'dral ba tshul khrims rnam par dag go //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa dag gis bslab pa'i gzhi mi 'dral ba tshul khrims rnam par dag go //
translated: In this way, one who possesses patience does not violate the basis of training through anger toward others, and so morality is purified.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas spro ba'i stobs kyis ched du 'khor ba khas blangs pa ni sems can gyi log par sgrub pa'i sdug bsngal bde blag tu bzod pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas spro ba'i stobs kyis ched du 'khor ba khas blangs pa ni sems can gyi log par sgrub pa'i sdug bsngal bde blag tu bzod pa rnam par dag go //
translated: The power of joy from the practice of effort is the pure patience of easily enduring the suffering of sentient beings‚Äô ingratitude.

original: bsam gtan ni bde ba dang bcas pa dang yid bde ba dang bcas par dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor ba brtson 'grus rnam par dag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni bde ba dang bcas pa dang yid bde ba dang bcas par dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor ba brtson 'grus rnam par dag go //
translated: The power of concentration is the pure effort of applying all virtuous dharmas with pleasure and mental joy.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'i chos rnam pa mang po la rnam par bltas nas nang du zhi bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phel bas bsam gtan rnam par dag ste /üîΩshes rab med la bsam gtan med //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'i chos rnam pa mang po la rnam par bltas nas nang du zhi bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phel bas bsam gtan rnam par dag ste / shes rab med la bsam gtan med //
translated: The power of wisdom is the pure concentration of looking at the many aspects of phenomena with wisdom and then pacifying the mind internally.

original: ces pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As the verse says, ‚ÄúWithout wisdom, there is no concentration.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rags pa'i rim gyis kyang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rags pa'i rim gyis kyang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in the same order as their coarseness.

original: sbyin pa ni thams cad kyi nang na rags te de'i phyir thog mar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni thams cad kyi nang na rags te de'i phyir thog mar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Generosity is the coarsest of all, so it is presented first.

original: de'i 'og tu bzod pa la sogs pas tshul khrims rags so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzod pa la sogs pas tshul khrims rags so //
translated: Then, after that, morality is gross in comparison with patience, and so on.

original: de bzhin du shas rab bas bsam gtan rags pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shas rab bas bsam gtan rags pa'i bar du'o //
translated: In the same way, concentration is gross in comparison with wisdom.

original: shes rab ni thams cad kyi nang na phra ste de'i phyir thams cad kyi tha mar bzhag go //
analyzed: shes rab ni thams cad kyi nang na phra ste de'i phyir thams cad kyi tha mar bzhag go //
translated: Wisdom is the most subtle of all, and therefore it is placed last.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What is the etymology of the perfections, such as giving?

original: sbyin pa chen po dang / skyon med pa dang / dri ma med pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po dang / skyon med pa dang / dri ma med pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Giving is called a perfection when it is great, irreproachable, and without pollution.

original: de la sbyin pa chen po ni nang dad phyi'i dngos po thams cad sbyin ba dang yun ring du sbyin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa chen po ni nang dad phyi'i dngos po thams cad sbyin ba dang yun ring du sbyin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great because one gives everything, both internal and external, and one gives for a long time.üîΩIt is irreproachable because it is free from the search for reward and the search for ripening.üîΩIt is without pollution because it is free from envy and avarice.

original: skyon med pa ni gnod pas kun tu tshol ba la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las sbyin pa mi zad pa las brtsams te bstan la /
analyzed: skyon med pa ni gnod pas kun tu tshol ba la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las sbyin pa mi zad pa las brtsams te bstan la /
translated: As the noble Aksayamati S≈´tra teaches, ‚ÄúWhat is the inexhaustibility of giving?

original: btsun pa sha ra tva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra tva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yang mi zad pa ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the generosity of the bodhisattvas is also inexhaustible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is immeasurable.

original: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu @273b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba yang tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu @273b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba yang tshad med pa ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the thorough preparation of the generosity of the bodhisattvas is also immeasurable.

original: tshe dang / spobs pa dang / bde ba dang / stobs dang / kha dog nye bar brtag pa'i phyir zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas sbyin no //
analyzed: tshe dang / spobs pa dang / bde ba dang / stobs dang / kha dog nye bar brtag pa'i phyir zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas sbyin no //
translated: In order to examine life, eloquence, happiness, strength, and complexion, they give food to those who want food.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sred pa bsal ba'i phyir btung ba 'dod pa rnams la ni btung ba sbyin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sred pa bsal ba'i phyir btung ba 'dod pa rnams la ni btung ba sbyin no //
translated: In order to remove the craving of afflictions, they give drink to those who want drink.

original: bde ba dang 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la ni bzhon pa sbyin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la ni bzhon pa sbyin no //
translated: In order to gather all the things that are happy and prosperous, they give vehicles to those who want vehicles.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang / mdog gser gyi kha dog yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos yongs su sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang / mdog gser gyi kha dog yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos yongs su sbyin ba'o //
translated: In order to purify the golden color of the skin, one should give clothing to those who want clothing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mar me 'dod pa rnams la ni mar me yongs su sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mar me 'dod pa rnams la ni mar me yongs su sbyin ba'o //
translated: In order to purify the divine eye of the Tathagatas, one should give lamps to those who want lamps.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dang bar bya ba'i phyir sil snyan 'dod pa rnams la ni sil snyan yongs su sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dang bar bya ba'i phyir sil snyan 'dod pa rnams la ni sil snyan yongs su sbyin ba'o //
translated: In order to purify the divine ear of the Tathagatas, one should give music to those who want music.

original: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dris byug pa'i phyir spos dang byung ba 'dod pa rnams la ni spos dang byug pa sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dris byug pa'i phyir spos dang byung ba 'dod pa rnams la ni spos dang byug pa sbyin ba'o //
translated: In order to perfume with the fragrance of morality, learning, and concentration, one should give perfumes and ointments to those who want perfumes and ointments.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa dang byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la ni phreng ba sbyin bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa dang byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la ni phreng ba sbyin bar bya'o //
translated: In order to obtain the flowers of the dharani, eloquence, and the limbs of enlightenment, one should give garlands to those who want garlands.

original: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma sbyin ba'o //
translated: In order to obtain a pleasant bodily scent, one gives perfumes to those who want perfumes.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba mchog tu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro bro ba thams cad 'dod pa rnams la ro bro ba thams cad sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba mchog tu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro bro ba thams cad 'dod pa rnams la ro bro ba thams cad sbyin ba'o //
translated: In order to perfect the supreme taste of the marks of a great person, one gives all kinds of tastes to those who want all kinds of tastes.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang skyabs dang / mgon dang dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang skyabs dang / mgon dang dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In order to be a refuge, a protection, a place of rest, and a support for all beings, one gives shelter to those who want shelter.

original: sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzims cha thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzims cha thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha sbyin par byed do //
translated: In order to abandon all obscurations, to attain the abode of Brahma, and to attain the bed of the Tathagatas, one gives beds to those who want beds.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sa thams cad kyi byang chub kyi snying po rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sa thams cad kyi byang chub kyi snying po rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin par byed do //
translated: They give seats to those who want seats, in order to obtain the vajra seat at the site of enlightenment in all the great trichiliocosm.

original: byang chub kyi yo byad thams cad bkang ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin ba'o //üîΩmi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsis yongs su bkang ba'i phyir sman 'dod pa rnams @274a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yo byad thams cad bkang ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin ba'o // mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsis yongs su bkang ba'i phyir sman 'dod pa rnams @274a * //
translated: They give necessities to those who want necessities, in order to fill all the necessities of enlightenment.

original: la sman sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: la sman sbyin ba'o //
translated: They give medicine to those who want medicine, in order to fill them with the ambrosia of immortality.

original: rang dbang dang rang nyams dang rang byung gi ye shes bskang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bran pho dang bran mo yongs su btang ba'i sbyin ba'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang dbang dang rang nyams dang rang byung gi ye shes bskang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bran pho dang bran mo yongs su btang ba'i sbyin ba'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: They give male and female servants to the bodhisattvas, in order to fill them with self-control, self-mastery, and self-arisen intuition.

original: dri ma med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pure is so called because it is free of resistances and their instincts.

original: dam pa rnam pa 'di gsum gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dam pa rnam pa 'di gsum gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of giving is so called because of these three kinds of supremacy.

original: dam pa rnam gsum ni 'dris pa dang bcas pa'i ngo bo nyid dam pa dang thabs dam pa dang 'bras bu dam pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa rnam gsum ni 'dris pa dang bcas pa'i ngo bo nyid dam pa dang thabs dam pa dang 'bras bu dam pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of supremacy are: supremacy of the nature of the entity which is familiarization, supremacy of the means, and supremacy of the result.

original: 'dris pa dam pa ni yun ring po nas sbyin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa dam pa ni yun ring po nas sbyin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Supremacy of familiarization should be understood as the practice of giving for a long time.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfections of morality, etc. should be understood in the same way.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyon med pa ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa rnam par spangs ba'i phyir te ci rigs su de mi zad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyon med pa ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa rnam par spangs ba'i phyir te ci rigs su de mi zad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is flawless because it is free from the superimposition of a self.

original: yang dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called a perfection because it has twelve kinds of supremacy.

original: dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis la rgya che ba dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis la rgya che ba dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supremacy of vastness is because it is not the desire for any mundane excellence and because it is the most excellent.

original: yun ring pa dam pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring pa dam pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest in duration, because it is cultivated for three measureless kalpas.

original: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest in aim, because it aims to benefit sentient beings.

original: zad mi shes pa dam pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos bas gdung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa dam pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos bas gdung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest in inexhaustibility, because it is not exhausted through being dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest in continuity, because one is devoted to the sameness of oneself and others.

original: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest in universality, because the perfections such as generosity are fulfilled for all sentient beings.

original: tshigs med pa dam pa ni gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs med pa dam pa ni gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest in nonconceptuality, because the perfections are fulfilled merely through rejoicing in the generosity and so forth of others.

original: dbang 'byor pa dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest mastery is due to the meditative concentration of the sky treasury and so forth, because generosity and so forth are perfected.

original: yongs su gzung ba dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest retention is due to retention by nonconceptual intuition.

original: rtsom pa dam pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa cher gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa dam pa ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa cher gyur pa la'o //
translated: The highest undertaking is on the stage of action out of faith, because patience increases.

original: thob pa dam pa ni sa dang po la'o //
analyzed: thob pa dam pa ni sa dang po la'o //
translated: The highest attainment is on the first stage.

original: rgyu @274b mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan brgyad po dag la'o //
analyzed: rgyu @274b mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan brgyad po dag la'o //
translated: The highest natural outcome is on the other eight stages.

original: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest accomplishment is on the tenth stage and on the stage of the transcendent lord, because the bodhisattva is accomplished and the buddha is accomplished.

original: yang dam pa rnams kyis spyad pa dang bgrod pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang dam pa rnams kyis spyad pa dang bgrod pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
translated: The perfections are so called because they are practiced and traversed by the highest beings.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyad pa dang bgrod ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyad pa dang bgrod ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúpracticed by the buddhas and bodhisattvas‚Äù means ‚Äútraversed.‚Äù

original: yang shes bya'i pha rol tu son pas pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang shes bya'i pha rol tu son pas pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, they are perfections because they reach the other shore of the knowable.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la gnas zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la gnas zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúabode of buddhahood‚Äù means ‚Äúthe other shore.‚Äù

original: yang bdag dang gzhan mchog tu gnod pa las sgrol bar byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang bdag dang gzhan mchog tu gnod pa las sgrol bar byed pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
translated: Moreover, they are perfections because they liberate oneself and others from the greatest harm.

original: bdag dang gzhan sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las bzla bar byed par ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las bzla bar byed par ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúliberate oneself and others from the ocean of suffering‚Äù means ‚Äúthe other shore.‚Äù

original: 'di ni re zhig thun mong gi nges tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig thun mong gi nges tshig go //
translated: This is the common explanation of the etymology.

original: so sor nges pa'i tshig ni sbyin bdag gi dbul ba sel ba dang / len pa po rnams kyi gdung ba sel ba'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i tshig ni sbyin bdag gi dbul ba sel ba dang / len pa po rnams kyi gdung ba sel ba'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
translated: The individual etymologies are as follows: Generosity is so called because it removes the poverty of the giver and the anguish of the recipient.

original: dbang po zhi ba thob pa dang 'gro ba bzang por sbyor ba dang / gsal ba'i gnas yin pas tshul khrims te /
analyzed: dbang po zhi ba thob pa dang 'gro ba bzang por sbyor ba dang / gsal ba'i gnas yin pas tshul khrims te /
translated: Morality is so called because it obtains the pacification of the faculties, connects one with good destinies, and is the basis of clarity.

original: go rims bzhin du dbang po rnams kyi sgo sdom par byed pa dang bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du dbang po rnams kyi sgo sdom par byed pa dang bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are, respectively, the door of restraint of the faculties, the cause of going to good destinies, the absence of regret, etc., and the basis for nirvana.

original: khro ba'i na tsha sel ba dang rma 'byin pa'i sems 'ongs pa sel ba dang // zhi ba brjod pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba'i na tsha sel ba dang rma 'byin pa'i sems 'ongs pa sel ba dang // zhi ba brjod pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the remedy for the sickness of anger, the removal of the thought of harming, and the expression of peace.

original: rma 'byin pa sems pa ni gang gis gnod pa byed pa rnams la lan du gnod pa ste de 'ongs pa 'dis 'bral bar byed pa ni sel bar rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: rma 'byin pa sems pa ni gang gis gnod pa byed pa rnams la lan du gnod pa ste de 'ongs pa 'dis 'bral bar byed pa ni sel bar rig par bya'o ;
translated: The thought of harming is the thought of retaliation for those who harm. The removal of that is the removal of the thought of harming.

original: / rma 'byin pa ni 'di dag las shar gnyer ba yod pas rma 'byin pa can te de dag bdag la mi 'jigs pa sgrogs pas bde ba ni bde ba sgrogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / rma 'byin pa ni 'di dag las shar gnyer ba yod pas rma 'byin pa can te de dag bdag la mi 'jigs pa sgrogs pas bde ba ni bde ba sgrogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who have the thought of harming are those who have the thought of harming others. Their happiness is the proclamation of safety, because they proclaim safety to those who are harmed.

original: sel ba 'phel bar spyod pas brtson 'grus te de sel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sel ba 'phel bar spyod pas brtson 'grus te de sel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: Vigor is the practice of increasing the removal of the latter. The practice of removing them is the removal of nonvirtuous dharmas by means of the two correct abandonings.

original: 'phel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis dge ba'i chos yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis dge ba'i chos yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The practice of increasing them is the correct achievement of virtuous dharmas by means of the two correct abandonings.

original: 'dzin pa dang sdom pa dang 'dul ba dang thob par byed pas bsam gtan te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang sdom pa dang 'dul ba dang thob par byed pas bsam gtan te /
translated: Dhyana is the practice of grasping, restraint, taming, and achieving.

original: de la 'dzin pa ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'o //üîΩsdom @275a * //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'o // sdom @275a * //
translated: Among them, grasping is the holding of the mind to the objective support.

original: ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba las sems yang dag par sdom pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba las sems yang dag par sdom pa'o //
translated: Restraint is the correct restraint of the mind from distraction.

original: 'dul ba ni kun nas dkris pa rnams rnam par gnon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni kun nas dkris pa rnams rnam par gnon pa'o //
translated: Taming is the suppression of the entanglements.

original: thob par byed pa ni dbang 'byor pa thob par byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thob par byed pa ni dbang 'byor pa thob par byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: Achieving is the achievement of mastery.

original: gzhan gyi smras pa shes pa dang so so rang gis shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / zhi ba thob pa dang / rab tu zhi ba thob pa dang / yon tan mchog tu sbyin pas shes rab ste de la gzhan gyi smras pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab bo //

translated: The wisdom that comes from the teachings of others, the wisdom that comes from one's own reflection, the wisdom that comes from the knowledge of the scriptures, the wisdom that comes from the knowledge of the world, and the wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues.

original: so sor rang gi shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rang gi shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that comes from one's own reflection is supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the knowledge of the scriptures is the mundane wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the knowledge of the world is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'o //üîΩzhi ba thob par bya ba'i phyir shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnyen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'o // zhi ba thob par bya ba'i phyir shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la gnyen por gyur pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that comes from the knowledge of the world is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.

original: yon tan mchog tu phyin par bya ba'i phyir shes pa ni yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i shes rab tu rig par bya'o //üîΩbsgom pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yon tan mchog tu phyin par bya ba'i phyir shes pa ni yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i shes rab tu rig par bya'o //üîΩbsgom pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane.üîΩThe wisdom that comes from the highest excellence of the virtues is the wisdom that is acquired subsequent to the supramundane

original: phung po la gnas pa nas dbang 'byor pa la gnas pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: phung po la gnas pa nas dbang 'byor pa la gnas pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from the stage of abiding in the aggregates up to the stage of mastery.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: phung po gnas pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: phung po gnas pa bsgom pa ste /
translated: The meditation is the stage of the aggregates,

original: yid la byed pa bsam pa yin //
analyzed: yid la byed pa bsam pa yin //
translated: the mental attention is the aspiration,

original: thabs dang dbang 'byor de bzhin de //
analyzed: thabs dang dbang 'byor de bzhin de //
translated: the means and mastery are just so,

original: de dag thams cad brjod pa yin //
analyzed: de dag thams cad brjod pa yin //
translated: all of them are declared.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:üîΩCause, fruition, aspiration,

original: rgyu dang rnam smin smon lam dang / so sor rtog pa phung po 'dra //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rnam smin smon lam dang / so sor rtog pa phung po 'dra // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: and discrimination are like the aggregates.

original: de la phung po la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la phung po la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, the aggregates are of four kinds:

original: de la rgyu la gnas pa ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu la gnas pa ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the cause is the practice of the perfections through the power of wisdom.

original: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni gang phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni gang phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: Abiding in fruition is the power of perfection.

original: smon lam la gnas pa ni gang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: smon lam la gnas pa ni gang sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis so //
translated: Abiding in aspiration is the power of former aspirations.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis gnas pa ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis gnas pa ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Abiding by the power of discernment is the repeated practice of the transcendences by the power of wisdom.

original: yid la byed pa la gnas pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa la gnas pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: Abiding by mental attention is fourfold.

original: mos pa yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni gang la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la mos pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed pa bsgom pa ni gang la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i mdo sde la mos pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation by the mental attention of conviction is the cultivation of conviction in the scriptures which are endowed with all the transcendences.

original: ro myong ba yid la byed pas bsgom pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams la yon tan mthong ba'i tshul gyis ro myang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ro myong ba yid la byed pas bsgom pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams la yon tan mthong ba'i tshul gyis ro myang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Cultivation by the mental attention of relish is the relishing of the transcendences already attained by the method of seeing their virtues.üîΩCultivation by the mental attention of delight is the delight of the bodhisattva in the generosity, etc. of all beings in all universes.

original: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas @275b bsgom pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas @275b bsgom pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: Cultivation by the mental attention of dedication is the dedication of all one's virtues to the complete enlightenment of all beings.

original: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pas bsgom pa ni bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi ma 'ongs ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pas bsgom pa ni bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi ma 'ongs ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: Meditation with the attention of delight is delighting in the future special transcendences of oneself and all beings.

original: bsam pa la gnas pha na pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: bsam pa la gnas pha na pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa rnam pa drug ste /
translated: When one is established in the intention, there are six kinds of meditation on the transcendences.

original: mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa dang / yangs pa'i bsam pa dang / dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa dang / gos pa med pa'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa dang / yangs pa'i bsam pa dang / dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa dang / gos pa med pa'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention of non-satisfaction, the intention of vast extent, the intention of delight, the intention of service, the intention of non-pollution, and the intention of virtue.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gcig cig gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su gang ba dang lus gang+g'a'i klung gcig la sbyin par byed
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gcig cig gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su gang ba dang lus gang+g'a'i klung gcig la sbyin par byed
translated: The bodhisattva's intention of non-satisfaction with generosity is that a single bodhisattva would give to one being a world-realm filled with the seven jewels and his own body, and would continue giving to each being in turn in each of the limitless world-realms.

original: ces so // de bzhin du skad cig re re la gang+g'a'i klung gi bya ma snyed kyi bskal par sbyin par byed cing sems can gcig la ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yongs su
analyzed: ces so // de bzhin du skad cig re re la gang+g'a'i klung gi bya ma snyed kyi bskal par sbyin par byed cing sems can gcig la ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yongs su
translated: In the same way, for as many eons as there are sands in the Ganges, in every moment of consciousness, he gives gifts to each sentient being, and to the entire realm of sentient beings, as he does to the first one, in order to bring them to

original: smin par byed la /üîΩrnam grangs 'dis de la sbyin pas mi ngoms pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' nyid de /
analyzed: smin par byed la / rnam grangs 'dis de la sbyin pas mi ngoms pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' nyid de /
translated: complete maturity in unsurpassed, supreme enlightenment.üîΩIn this way, the bodhisattva is never satisfied with giving gifts.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa mi ngoms pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa mi ngoms pa yin no //
translated: This kind of aspiration is the bodhisattva‚Äôs never-ending aspiration for giving.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa de lta bur sbyin pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa skad cig tsam yang nyams par mi byed cing rgyun mi gcod de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa de lta bur sbyin pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa skad cig tsam yang nyams par mi byed cing rgyun mi gcod de /
translated: From the time he first generates the intention until he sits at the site of awakening, the bodhisattva never fails to give, never interrupts the practice, even for a moment.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i yangs pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i yangs pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva's magnanimous thought with regard to generosity.

original: de ltar sbyin pas sems can de dag rjes su 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shin tu dga' ba yin gyi sbyin pa des yongs su gzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pas sems can de dag rjes su 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shin tu dga' ba yin gyi sbyin pa des yongs su gzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who cares for sentient beings through generosity is very happy, but those sentient beings who are helped by that generosity are not like that.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bsam pa'o //üîΩgang dag la de ltar sbyin pas phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag ni bdag la phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpa' mthong gi bdag gis ni @276a * //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bsam pa'o // gang dag la de ltar sbyin pas phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag ni bdag la phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpa' mthong gi bdag gis ni @276a * //
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva's joyful thought with regard to generosity.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: Those sentient beings whom the bodhisattva helps through generosity are seen by the bodhisattva as helping him, not the other way around.

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the support for the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de 'di ni sbyin pa la byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Whatever this kind of thought may be, it is the bodhisattva's helpful thought in regard to generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la de ltar sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams yang pa mngon par du byas kyang lan du phan 'dogs pa'am rnam par smin pa mi 'dod de rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa'i
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la de ltar sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams yang pa mngon par du byas kyang lan du phan 'dogs pa'am rnam par smin pa mi 'dod de rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa'i
translated: Even though the bodhisattva has thus generated great merit from generosity in regard to sentient beings, he does not desire to repay the favor or its evolutionary development.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gos pa med pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i gos pa med pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Whatever this kind of thought may be, it is the bodhisattva's unattached thought in regard to the perfection of generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i phung po spangs pa'i rnam par smin pa de lta bu'ang sems can rnams kyi yin par mngon par dga' bar byed kyi bdag la ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i phung po spangs pa'i rnam par smin pa de lta bu'ang sems can rnams kyi yin par mngon par dga' bar byed kyi bdag la ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva rejoices in the evolutionary development of the mass of generosity, even though it is for the sake of sentient beings, but not for his own sake.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: He makes it common to all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: I dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva‚Äôs virtuous thought of cultivating the perfection of giving.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la byang chub sems dpa' mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa' lus gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gyur zhing de'i
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar la byang chub sems dpa' mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa' lus gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gyur zhing de'i
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs insatiable thought with regard to cultivating the perfection of morality up to cultivating the perfection of wisdom is this: Suppose a bodhisattva were to become as many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: tshe'i tshad bskal pa gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gyur la /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad bskal pa gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gyur la /
translated: and his life were to last as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: rgyun du yo byad thams cad kyis phongs par gyur cing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes rab tu gang ba na spyod lam bzhi byed kyang /
analyzed: rgyun du yo byad thams cad kyis phongs par gyur cing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes rab tu gang ba na spyod lam bzhi byed kyang /
translated: and he were to be constantly lacking in all necessities, and he were to walk around in the great billionfold world system filled with fire, and he were to make offerings to all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas in the great billionfold world system with his own flesh,

original: skang cig gcig la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas skad cig gcig la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la bsgom zhing rnam grangs 'dis tshul khrims kyi phung po ji snyed pa dang / shes rab kyi phung po ji snyed pa gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po nas shes rab kyi phung po de bsgom yang byang chub sems dpa' de mi ngoms pa'o //
analyzed: skang cig gcig la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas skad cig gcig la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la bsgom zhing rnam grangs 'dis tshul khrims kyi phung po ji snyed pa dang / shes rab kyi phung po ji snyed pa gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul khrims kyi phung po nas shes rab kyi phung po de bsgom yang byang chub sems dpa' de mi ngoms pa'o //
translated: In a single moment, he cultivates the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom. By this method, he cultivates the aggregate of morality up to the aggregate of wisdom, however much is necessary to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. But the bodhisattva is not satisfied with that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @276b bsgom pa'i bar du bsgom la byang chub sems dpa' yangs pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @276b bsgom pa'i bar du bsgom la byang chub sems dpa' yangs pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva cultivates the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom until he sits at the seat of enlightenment. The bodhisattva has an expansive attitude.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa des sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rab tu dga' ba yin gyi rjes su gzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de ltar ma
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa des sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rab tu dga' ba yin gyi rjes su gzung ba'i sems can de dag ni de ltar ma
translated: The bodhisattva who cares for sentient beings by cultivating the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom is joyful, but those sentient beings who are cared for are not like that.

original: yin te / rnam pa de lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: yin te / rnam pa de lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dga' ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This kind of thought is the bodhisattva's joyful thought in cultivating the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgoms nas gang dag la phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag ni bdag la shin tu phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpa' mthong gi bdag ni ma yin
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgoms nas gang dag la phan 'dogs pa'i sems can de dag ni bdag la shin tu phan 'dogs par byang chub sems dpa' mthong gi bdag ni ma yin
translated: The bodhisattva sees those sentient beings whom he benefits by cultivating the perfection of morality up to the perfection of wisdom as greatly benefiting him, but not himself.

original: te / de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they teach them unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o //üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las byung ba'i bsod nams mang po mngon par 'du byas kyang de la lan du phan 'dogs pa'am rnam par
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las byung ba'i bsod nams mang po mngon par 'du byas kyang de la lan du phan 'dogs pa'am rnam par
translated: Whatever kind of thought this is, it is the bodhisattva's helpful thought in the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: smin pa la 'dod pa med de /
analyzed: smin pa la 'dod pa med de /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva, although he has thus created much merit from the production of the perfection of morality up to the production of the perfection of wisdom, does not desire a return for that favor or its karmic maturation.

original: 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi bar gyi bsgom pa la gos pa med pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi bar gyi bsgom pa la gos pa med pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Whatever kind of thought this is, it is the bodhisattva's unattached thought in the cultivation of the perfection of morality up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba nas shes rab kyi bar gyi bsod nams kyi phung po'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang sems can rnams kyi yin par mngon par dga' bar byed kyi bdag laüîΩni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba nas shes rab kyi bar gyi bsod nams kyi phung po'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang sems can rnams kyi yin par mngon par dga' bar byed kyi bdag la ni ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva dedicates the results of the evolution of the mass of his own merit from the cultivation of the transcendence of morality up to the cultivation of the transcendence of wisdom, not for his own sake,üîΩbut for the sake of all beings.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //üîΩrnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @277a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o // rnam pa 'di lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @277a * //
translated: He makes it common to all beings and dedicates it to supreme wisdom.

original: pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: This kind of aspiration is the bodhisattva's virtuous aspiration for the cultivation of the transcendence of morality up to the cultivation of the transcendence of wisdom.

original: thabs la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva's aspiration for the means in the cultivation of the transcendences?

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: so sor rtog pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of discernment, there is the purity of the three sectors in nonconceptual intuition. That is the method, because it is the basis for all mental attentions.

original: dbang 'byor pa la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cultivation of the transcendences in the context of mastery is threefold.

original: lus la dbang 'byor ba dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa dang / bshad pa la dbang 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: lus la dbang 'byor ba dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa dang / bshad pa la dbang 'byor pa'o //
translated: It is mastery over body, mastery over activity, and mastery over teaching.

original: lus la dbang 'byor pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: lus la dbang 'byor pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: Mastery over body should be seen as the two bodies of the transcendent lords.

original: rang bzhin dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: They are the natural body and the beatific body.

original: de la spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa ni sprul pa'i skur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa ni sprul pa'i skur blta bar bya ste /
translated: Mastery over activity should be seen as the emanation body,

original: des sems can thams cad la spyod pa kun du ston pa'o //
analyzed: des sems can thams cad la spyod pa kun du ston pa'o //
translated: because it displays all activities for all sentient beings.

original: bshad pa la dbang 'byor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam pa thams cad du bshad pa la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa la dbang 'byor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam pa thams cad du bshad pa la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Mastery over teaching is the absence of obstruction in teaching all aspects of the six transcendences.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni rton pa bco brgyad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni rton pa bco brgyad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
translated: The analysis is to be seen as the analysis of the six perfections by means of the eighteen foundations.

original: rton pa bco brgyad ni lus rton pa dang sems rton pa dang / dge ba rton pa dang / bde 'gro rton pa dang / byang chub rton pa dang / snying rje rton pa dang / sems can yongs su mi gtong bar rton pa dang /
analyzed: rton pa bco brgyad ni lus rton pa dang sems rton pa dang / dge ba rton pa dang / bde 'gro rton pa dang / byang chub rton pa dang / snying rje rton pa dang / sems can yongs su mi gtong bar rton pa dang /
translated: The eighteen foundations are: the foundation of body, the foundation of mind, the foundation of virtue, the foundation of good destiny, the foundation of enlightenment, the foundation of compassion, the foundation of not abandoning beings,

original: dman pa'i sems yongs su 'dor bar rton pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyor ba la rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sgrub pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad par rton pa dang /
analyzed: dman pa'i sems yongs su 'dor bar rton pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyor ba la rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sgrub pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad par rton pa dang /
translated: the foundation of rejecting the inferior thought, the foundation of acquiescence in the non-arising of things, the foundation of application to the roots of virtue, the foundation of accomplishment of the roots of virtue, the foundation of inexhaustibility of the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la yongs su mi skyo bar rton pa dang / bsam pa'i don thams cad 'byor par rton pa dang / tshogs sdud par rton pa dang / sa la 'jug pa rton pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par sgrub pa rton pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la yongs su mi skyo bar rton pa dang / bsam pa'i don thams cad 'byor par rton pa dang / tshogs sdud par rton pa dang / sa la 'jug pa rton pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par sgrub pa rton pa dang /
translated: 1) Relying on the roots of virtue without getting tired; 2) Relying on the fulfillment of all the aims of intention; 3) Relying on gathering the accumulations; 4) Relying on entering the stages; 5) Relying on accomplishing the qualities of a Buddha; 6) Relying on accomplishing the Buddha activities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sgrub pa rton pa ste sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum tha dad pas gsum gsum gyis go rims bzhin du bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sgrub pa rton pa ste sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum tha dad pas gsum gsum gyis go rims bzhin du bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as being included in the three each, in order, by the three kinds of generosity and so forth.

original: de la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ni zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ni zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of generosity are: 1) the generosity of material things, 2) the generosity of fearlessness, and 3) the generosity of the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims la rnam pa gsum ste sdom @277b ba'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshul khrims la rnam pa gsum ste sdom @277b ba'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The three kinds of morality are: 1) the morality of restraint, 2) the morality of gathering virtue, and 3) the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of patience are patience in withstanding injury, patience in accepting suffering, and patience in resolving the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can don bya ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can don bya ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The three kinds of effort are armor-effort, applied effort, and effort that does not turn back.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni mthong ba'i chos bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par gsal ba'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni mthong ba'i chos bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par gsal ba'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The three kinds of meditation are meditation for the sake of happiness in this life, meditation for the sake of the superknowledges, and meditation for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of wisdom are wisdom that focuses on the conventional, wisdom that focuses on the ultimate, and wisdom that focuses on benefiting sentient beings.

original: de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni lus la rton pa te bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams kyis len pa po la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni lus la rton pa te bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams kyis len pa po la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Material giving is based on the body, because it benefits the recipient by means of the necessities of life such as food and drink.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni sems la rton pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni sems la rton pa ste /
translated: Giving fearlessness is based on the mind,

original: yid mi bde ba'i bye brag dang bral bar byas bas sems kyi dbugs nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i bye brag dang bral bar byas bas sems kyi dbugs nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it benefits the mind by removing the specific forms of mental dissatisfaction.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be connected in the same way.

original: dman pa'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su skyo bas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems te /
analyzed: dman pa'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su skyo bas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems te /
translated: The inferior mind is the thought of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha, because the bodhisattva is completely discouraged by the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de yongs su 'dor ba rton pa ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su 'dor ba rton pa ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod par rigs par bya'o //
translated: The patience of accepting suffering should be understood as the avoidance of that.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mi thad pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba lhag par byed pas 'khor ba ji srid la phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yang yongs su mi gtong bas te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mi thad pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba lhag par byed pas 'khor ba ji srid la phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yang yongs su mi gtong bas te /
translated: The non-abandonment of the root of the wholesome is due to the preeminence of the activity for the sake of all beings, and also due to the non-abandonment of samsara for as long as the world exists, even in the realm of nirvana which is not a mere static state.

original: de rton pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rton pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus su rig par bya'o //
translated: The reliance on this is to be known as the meditative concentration for the sake of beings, which is the vigour of the bodhisattva.

original: tshogs sdud pa ni thob pa la brten nas gdul bya rnams mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang / sems mnyam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa de rton pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: tshogs sdud pa ni thob pa la brten nas gdul bya rnams mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang / sems mnyam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa de rton pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The attraction of a following is the bestowal of instruction and counsel for the sake of the disciples in order to establish them in meditative concentration and to establish their minds in meditative concentration, on the basis of attainment. The reliance on this is the meditative concentration for the sake of beings.

original: sa la 'jug pa ni chos la mos pa sngon du btang ba'i @278a * //
analyzed: sa la 'jug pa ni chos la mos pa sngon du btang ba'i @278a * //
translated: The entry to the spiritual levels is the entry to the Joyous level, which is preceded by the conviction about the Dharma and is due to the complete fulfilment of the stores of merit and direct intuition.

original: bshad pa gang gis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas rab tu dga' ba'i sa la 'jug pa ste de ston par ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa gang gis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas rab tu dga' ba'i sa la 'jug pa ste de ston par ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of this is the meditative concentration for the sake of beings, which is the wisdom of the bodhisattva.

original: lhag ma ni legs par sbyar ba'i phyir sbyar bar ma byas so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni legs par sbyar ba'i phyir sbyar bar ma byas so //
translated: The rest are not mentioned because they are well known.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni sbyin ba bdun te /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni sbyin ba bdun te /
translated: The classification of generosity is sevenfold:

original: rtsa ba'i sbyin pa ni rigs kyi gnas skabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste rigs tsam la brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sbyin pa ni rigs kyi gnas skabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste rigs tsam la brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Generosity of the root is the perfection of generosity of the bodhisattva in the stage of lineage because he gives in dependence on the mere lineage.

original: blangs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs ba ste smon lam yang dag par blangs pa la brten nas sbyin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blangs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs ba ste smon lam yang dag par blangs pa la brten nas sbyin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Generosity of the vow is in the stage of generating the will to enlightenment because he gives in dependence on the vow of aspiration.

original: rjes su 'dzin pa'i sbyin pa ni bdag dang gzhan don sgrub pa'i gnas skabs pa'o //üîΩ'dzin pa nges pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni de kho na'i don la yongs su rtogs pa gnas skabs pa'i ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa'i sbyin pa ni bdag dang gzhan don sgrub pa'i gnas skabs pa'o // 'dzin pa nges pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni de kho na'i don la yongs su rtogs pa gnas skabs pa'i ste /
translated: Generosity of maintenance is in the stage of accomplishing the aims of self and other.üîΩGenerosity of nonconceptual grasping is in the stage of thorough conceptualization of reality because the grasping of the donor to conceptualization is absent.

original: sbyin bdag la gnas pa rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag la gnas pa rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Generosity of the field is in the stage of the branches of enlightenment because he gives to the field of the perfections.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni mthun pa'i gnas skabs pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni mthun pa'i gnas skabs pa ni /
translated: Generosity without possessiveness is for the occasion of the compatible stage.

original: pha rol gyi yo byad yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis nam mkha' las lag pa brkyang nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rin po che la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi yo byad yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis nam mkha' las lag pa brkyang nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rin po che la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one extends one's hand from the sky and rains down whatever is wished for, jewels and so on, through the concentrations such as the sky treasure, which are without possessiveness for the goods of others.

original: so sor rig pa'i sbyin pa ni yongs su smin pa'i gnas skabs pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rig pa'i sbyin pa ni yongs su smin pa'i gnas skabs pa ste /
translated: Generosity of individual awareness is for the occasion of the stage of evolutionary maturity.

original: 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one acts in accordance with the discipline of others, as it is.

original: sbyin pa chen po ni byang chub mchog gi gnas skabs pa'i ste bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po ni byang chub mchog gi gnas skabs pa'i ste bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great generosity is for the occasion of the stage of supreme enlightenment, because it is unsurpassed.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi bar du ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi bar du ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o ;
translated: Thus, one should understand the other perfections, up to wisdom, in the same way, as appropriate.

original: / bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i sas bsdus pa'i phyir te de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs bsdus pa'i 'di ni dpe tsam mo //
analyzed: / bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i sas bsdus pa'i phyir te de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rigs bsdus pa'i 'di ni dpe tsam mo //
translated: The brief summary is that the perfections are included in the stages of the bodhisattva, for they are included in the stages.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni rigs kyis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni rigs kyis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of giving, etc. should be understood as included in the spiritual gene.

original: sems bskyed pa bsdus pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa bsdus pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The brief summary of the generation of the resolve is that the generation of the resolve is included in the special generation of the resolve.

original: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The generation of the resolve is twofold:

original: khyad par can ma yin pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: non-special and special.

original: de la khyad par can ma yin pa ni //
analyzed: de la khyad par can ma yin pa ni //
translated: The non-special is

original: kye ma'o bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon @278b par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar shog cig snyam pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma'o bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon @278b par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar shog cig snyam pa'o //
translated: the thought, ‚ÄúOh, may I fully awaken to highest genuine full Awakening!‚Äù

original: khyad par du 'phags pa ni de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par shog shig snyam pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa ni de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par shog shig snyam pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The superiority is that one should think, ‚ÄúMay I complete the perfection of generosity in that way, up to the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: This superior generation of the thought should be known as the summary of the perfections,

original: de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag dang gzhan gyi don bsdus pa gang sbyin pa'i phung po yongs su rdzogs pa 'di dag ni bdag gi don to /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsdus pa gang sbyin pa'i phung po yongs su rdzogs pa 'di dag ni bdag gi don to /
translated: because they are the cause of those.üîΩThe summary of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô aims is that the completion of the aggregate of generosity is one‚Äôs own aim.

original: gang gzhan la yo byad nye bar bsgrubs pas rjes su 'dzin pa 'di ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: gang gzhan la yo byad nye bar bsgrubs pas rjes su 'dzin pa 'di ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The benefit of others is that one cares for others by providing them with necessities.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis bsdus pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis bsdus pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The summary by the remaining perfections should be understood in the same way.üîΩThe ultimate is the perfection of wisdom, because it is the ultimate truth.

original: don dam pa chos kyi dbyings las brtsams pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa chos kyi dbyings las brtsams pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The beginning of the ultimate is the perfection of generosity, because it is the first of the perfections.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs bsag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i snod du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs bsag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i snod du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The accumulation of the equipment of intuition is for the sake of establishing the vessel of omniscience.

original: ye shes yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The holding of intuition is begun for the sake of the accomplishment of omniscience.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa ni lnga po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
