analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa ni lnga po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The holding of intuition is begun for the sake of the five perfections, because they are in accord with the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of intuition is begun for the sake of the perfection of wisdom, because it is the essence of perfect intuition.

original: de ltar na de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de ni dam pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de ni dam pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the essence of reality and perfect intuition are the highest, and are to be known as included in generosity and so on.

original: dpe brjod pa 'dis bsgrub pa lhag ma rnams bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe brjod pa 'dis bsgrub pa lhag ma rnams bstan par bya'o //
translated: This example should be understood to illustrate the remaining perfections.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang khro ba dang le lo dang rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab ste /üîΩsbyin pa la sogs pa'i go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang khro ba dang le lo dang rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab ste / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i go rims bzhin no //
translated: The resistances to the transcendences are stinginess, corrupt morality, hostility, laziness, distraction, and false wisdom, respectively.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis bsdus pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa de yang dag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis bsdus pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa de yang dag pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The resistances to the transcendences should be understood as the resistances to the transcendences, and also as the resistances to the knowable, in the order of the transcendences.

original: phan yon ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga'i skabs su dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan yon ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga'i skabs su dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The benefits of the transcendences should be understood as immeasurable in the context of the fivefold result of the transcendences.

original: de yang bsdus na 'di dag gi rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / mthong @279a * //
analyzed: de yang bsdus na 'di dag gi rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / mthong @279a * //
translated: In brief, the result of freedom from the resistances to the transcendences is the elimination of their resistances. The result of evolutionary development is the increase of the transcendences. The result of natural outcome is the attainment of the successive stages of the bodhisattva. The result of beneficial quality is the benefit of self and other. The result of power is the ability to manifest the transcendences at will. The result of supremacy is the attainment of the transcendence of a Buddha.

original: pa'i chos la bdag gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyi ma la gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog dam pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / byang chub chen po dbang gi 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: pa'i chos la bdag gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyi ma la gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog dam pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / byang chub chen po dbang gi 'bras bu dang /
translated: The result of conscious effort is the acceptance of self and other. The result of natural outcome is the arising of the most excellent and sublime qualities in the future. The result of sovereignty is great enlightenment.

original: longs spyod chen po dang bde 'gror 'gro ba dang kho na med pa dang / dbye ba med pa dang mi bde ba med pa dang yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems can la dbang ba dang lus la gnod pa med pa dang dbang che bar grags pa ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po dang bde 'gror 'gro ba dang kho na med pa dang / dbye ba med pa dang mi bde ba med pa dang yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems can la dbang ba dang lus la gnod pa med pa dang dbang che bar grags pa ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The results of generosity and so forth should be understood as the great enjoyments, rebirth in the happy realms, non-deprivation, non-division, non-misery, much happiness, sovereignty over sentient beings, non-harm to the body, and great fame, respectively.

original: gcig la gcig rnam par nges pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gcig la gcig rnam par nges pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The mutual determination of the perfections is threefold:

original: sbyor ba las gyur pa dang / dbye ba las gyur pa dang / rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las gyur pa dang / dbye ba las gyur pa dang / rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur ba'o //
translated: mutual determination in terms of practice, mutual determination in terms of classification, and mutual determination in terms of teaching.

original: de la sbyor ba las gyur pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad 'dus par dmigs te 'di lta ste nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba las gyur pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad 'dus par dmigs te 'di lta ste nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The perfection of application is the observation of the inclusion of all giving, etc. It is the application to the giving of inner and outer things.

original: de la gang yongs su gtong ba de ni sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang yongs su gtong ba de ni sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: In that, the giving of inner and outer things is the perfection of giving.

original: de la byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni gang gzhan la kun nas mnar sems dang gnod pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba sdom pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni gang gzhan la kun nas mnar sems dang gnod pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba sdom pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: In that, the possession of a loving mind, the restraint from malice, harm, and violence toward others, is the perfection of morality.

original: de nyid la gang nye bar bskor ba dang phongs pa dang skyo ba la ji mi snyam pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gang nye bar bskor ba dang phongs pa dang skyo ba la ji mi snyam pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: In that, the indifference to the troubles and weariness of those very beings is the perfection of patience.

original: de nyid la gang phyir zhing sems spro ba de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gang phyir zhing sems spro ba de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: In that, the delight in the repeated practice is the perfection of effort.

original: de nyid la gang sems rtse gcig pa ste dge ba las phyi rol tu mi 'phro ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gang sems rtse gcig pa ste dge ba las phyi rol tu mi 'phro ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the one-pointedness of mind on that very object, the non-scattering of the mind externally to virtue.

original: de nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du legs par gzung ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du legs par gzung ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the non-apprehension of cause and effect as they are, and the non-apprehension of the view as supreme.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, the other perfections should be applied in the same way up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni thams cad du sbyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni thams cad du sbyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The giving of fearlessness is giving in all cases.

original: de rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su sbyor bas rab tu dbye ba dang / bskyed pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su sbyor bas rab tu dbye ba dang / bskyed pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The analysis of giving is threefold: analysis of its nature, analysis of its application, and analysis of its development.

original: de la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par gtong ba dang sdom pa dang ji mi snyam pa dang mngon par spro ba dang sems gnas pa dang rab @279b tu rnam par dbye ba ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par gtong ba dang sdom pa dang ji mi snyam pa dang mngon par spro ba dang sems gnas pa dang rab @279b tu rnam par dbye ba ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: The nature of these is giving, restraint, tolerance, effort, meditation, and wisdom, respectively.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba ni de la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rjes su 'jug pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba ni de la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rjes su 'jug pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Application to generosity, etc. is the engagement of the perfections in their respective bases, as before.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su sbyor ba ni 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'o ;
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su sbyor ba ni 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'o ;
translated: Application to generosity, etc. is the encouragement of others to generosity, etc. , the praise of generosity, etc. , and the delight in generosity, etc.

original: / de la sbyin pa la sogs pa bskyed pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: / de la sbyin pa la sogs pa bskyed pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la 'jog pa'o //
translated: The generation of generosity, etc. is the establishment of generosity, etc. in the mental continuum of another.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity is the giving of material things.

original: de ma yin pa'i gzhan lnga ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gzhan lnga ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The other five are the giving of fearlessness.

original: thams cad ni dam pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste gzhan gyi sems rgyud la bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni dam pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste gzhan gyi sems rgyud la bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of them are the giving of the holy Dharma, because they are generated in the mental continuum of another.

original: de las rab tu phye nas bstan pa la gyur pa ni gcig nas rtogs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de las rab tu phye nas bstan pa la gyur pa ni gcig nas rtogs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the distinctions is from the one, i.e., the realization, etc.

original: 'di lta ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de yin nam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de yin nam /
translated: For example, is the perfection of giving the same as the perfection of morality?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang de yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang de yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is the perfection of morality the same as the perfection of giving?

original: tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ste /üîΩtshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang de'o //üîΩsbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ste / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang de'o // sbyin ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: The answer is:üîΩThe perfection of morality is the perfection of giving.üîΩThere is the perfection of giving which is not the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma zin pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma zin pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of giving not conjoined with the perfection of morality.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of wisdom should be connected with the words of the perfection of giving and the rest.

original: sbyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam pha rol tu phyin pa de thams cad sbyin pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam pha rol tu phyin pa de thams cad sbyin pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is all giving the perfection of giving, or is all that perfection giving?

original: mu gsum du 'gyur te sbyin pa yin la pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin ba'o //
analyzed: mu gsum du 'gyur te sbyin pa yin la pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin ba'o //
translated: There are three possibilities: Giving that is not a perfection is giving not dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa ma yin pa la pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa yang yod de bshad pa ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa ma yin pa la pha rol tu phyin pa yin pa yang yod de bshad pa ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: There is a perfection that is not giving, namely, the perfections other than giving.üîΩThere is giving that is a perfection, namely, giving dedicated to great enlightenment.üîΩThere is giving that is neither a perfection, namely, giving not dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la brtsams te re re la mu gsum gsum du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la brtsams te re re la mu gsum gsum du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, beginning with the perfection of wisdom, each should be connected with the three possibilities.

original: sbyin pa kun du spyod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams bskyed dam zhe na mu bzhir 'gyur te /üîΩmu dang po ni byang chub chen por yongs su ma @280a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa kun du spyod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams bskyed dam zhe na mu bzhir 'gyur te / mu dang po ni byang chub chen por yongs su ma @280a * //
translated: Are all those who practice generosity generating merit that arises from the cause of the perfection of generosity? There are four possibilities.

original: bsngos pa'i sbyin pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsngos pa'i sbyin pa spyod pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is the practice of generosity that is not dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: mu gnyis pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / yid rab tu dga' bas so //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / yid rab tu dga' bas so //
translated: The second possibility is the dedication of generosity to the perfection of generosity, the expression of praise, and the delight of mind.

original: mu gsum pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pas so ;
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pas so ;
translated: The third possibility is the practice of generosity that is dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: / mu bzhi ba ni rnam pa 'di dag ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: / mu bzhi ba ni rnam pa 'di dag ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is the non-realization of these aspects.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las brtsams te re re la yang mu bzhi bzhir sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las brtsams te re re la yang mu bzhi bzhir sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, beginning with the perfection of wisdom, each one should be analyzed into four possibilities.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag kyang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yin te sbyin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag kyang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi yin te sbyin pa de nyid do //
translated: And those perfections are the four means of gathering: that very generosity is the means of gathering through generosity.

original: tshul khrims dang bzod pa ni ngag snyan pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang bzod pa ni ngag snyan pa'o //
translated: Morality and patience are agreeable speech.

original: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan ni don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan ni don mthun pa'o //
translated: Exertion and meditation are conduct in common.

original: shes rab ni don dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni don dpyod pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the analysis of the meaning.

original: sdom pa gsum yang yin te /
analyzed: sdom pa gsum yang yin te /
translated: They are also the three vows.

original: dang po bzhi sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sbam gtan ni sems can don byed do //
analyzed: dang po bzhi sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sbam gtan ni sems can don byed do //
translated: The first four are the morality of vow. Meditation is the morality of benefiting sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyi ni dge ba'i chos sdud do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni dge ba'i chos sdud do //
translated: Wisdom is the morality of gathering virtuous natures.

original: bslab pa gsum yang de nyid do //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum yang de nyid do //
translated: They are also the three trainings.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang de nyid yin te lam gnyis kyi skabs su bshad do //üîΩlam gnyis kyang tshogs lam dang sbyor lam ni 'jigs rten pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang de nyid yin te lam gnyis kyi skabs su bshad do // lam gnyis kyang tshogs lam dang sbyor lam ni 'jigs rten pa'o //
translated: They are also the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, as explained in the context of the two paths.üîΩThe two paths are mundane and supramundane.

original: mthong lam dang sgom lam ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong lam dang sgom lam ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin te /
translated: The mundane path is the path of accumulation and the path of preparation. The supramundane path is the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: de dag rgyas par phye ste bstan pa ni thabs nyams su blang ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rgyas par phye ste bstan pa ni thabs nyams su blang ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of these is the stages of practicing the means.

original: de ltar thabs kyi khyad par dang theg pa 'og ma las khyad par dgus 'phags te gang zhe na dmigs pa'i khyad par ni shes bya ji snyed pa dang ji lta ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar thabs kyi khyad par dang theg pa 'og ma las khyad par dgus 'phags te gang zhe na dmigs pa'i khyad par ni shes bya ji snyed pa dang ji lta ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is superior to the lower vehicles by nine distinctions of method. What are they? The distinction of object is that it has as its object the knowable as it is and as it appears.

original: nye bar bstan pa'i khyad par ni bskal ba grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa'i khyad par ni bskal ba grangs med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The distinction of teaching is that it perfects the accumulations of merit and wisdom in three incalculable aeons.

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i khyad par ni so sor rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyis gang zag dang chos bdag med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i khyad par ni so sor rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyis gang zag dang chos bdag med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The distinction of realization is that it realizes the selflessness of persons and of phenomena by means of the wisdom of individual investigation.

original: khas len pa'i khyad par ni bdag dang sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khas len pa'o //
analyzed: khas len pa'i khyad par ni bdag dang sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khas len pa'o //
translated: The distinction of assertion is that it asserts the equality of oneself and all sentient beings.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par ni sa bcu dag gis nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par ni sa bcu dag gis nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The distinction of definite release is that it is definitely released by means of the ten levels.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The distinction of retention is that it retains nonabiding nirvana.

original: gnas dang g-yog 'khor gyi khyad par ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba dang gdul @280b bya nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang g-yog 'khor gyi khyad par ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba dang gdul @280b bya nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: The difference in abode and retinue is the purification of the Buddha-field and the gathering of those to be disciplined.

original: btsun pa nye bar skyes pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung ris su skyes pa'o //
analyzed: btsun pa nye bar skyes pa'i khyad par ni sangs rgyas kyi gdung ris su skyes pa'o //
translated: The difference in birth is the birth in the family of the Buddha.

original: skye ba'i khyad par ni smon lam gyi dbang gis srid pa thams cad du skye ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par ni smon lam gyi dbang gis srid pa thams cad du skye ba'o //
translated: The difference in rebirth is the rebirth in all the modes of existence through the power of vow.

original: drug po de dag dang ldan pa'i chos kyang rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: drug po de dag dang ldan pa'i chos kyang rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: The Dharma is also explained as twofold, endowed with those six differences:

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang / 'bras bu'i chos so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang / 'bras bu'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma of practice and the Dharma of result.

original: sgrub pa'i chos ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste de nyid 'dir yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste de nyid 'dir yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of practice is the eightfold path of the noble ones, which is the thorough knowledge here.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi bye brag gis 'bras bu'i chos kyang rnam pa gnyis su'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi bye brag gis 'bras bu'i chos kyang rnam pa gnyis su'o //
translated: The Dharma of result is also twofold, according to the distinction of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: de la 'dus byas ni dge sbyang gi 'bras bu bzhi ste rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas ni dge sbyang gi 'bras bu bzhi ste rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Among them, the conditioned is the four fruits of the spiritual practitioner, which have the nature of the path of liberation.

original: 'dus ma byas ni nyon mongs pa spangs ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni nyon mongs pa spangs ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is nirvana, which is characterized by the abandonment of the defilements.

original: bstan bcos las ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin dge sbyong gi 'bras bur rnam par gzhag mod kyi 'on kyang mya ngan las 'das par logs shig tu bshad pas ba lang dang / glang zhes bya ba'i tshul du 'dus byas nyid du gzung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi rang bzhin dge sbyong gi 'bras bur rnam par gzhag mod kyi 'on kyang mya ngan las 'das par logs shig tu bshad pas ba lang dang / glang zhes bya ba'i tshul du 'dus byas nyid du gzung ngo //
translated: Although the treatise declares the nature of the conditioned and the unconditioned to be the fruit of the SraÃÑvaka, nevertheless, since nirvana is mentioned separately, it is included among the conditioned, like the cow and the ox.

original: yang na yongs su dag pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'dir mya ngan las 'das par 'dod de de la nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na yongs su dag pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'dir mya ngan las 'das par 'dod de de la nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the suchness of complete purification is accepted as nirvana here, because it is the object of the path of purification.

original: 'bras bu 'di brjod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams lam 'di nyid kyi gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i tshul du bsgrubs nas 'bras bu rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di brjod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams lam 'di nyid kyi gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i tshul du bsgrubs nas 'bras bu rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement of this fruit is for the purpose of teaching that the SÃÅraÃÑvakas and Pratyekabuddhas, having practiced this very path in the manner of the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena, respectively, attain the fruit.

original: de yang de kho na ma nor ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ni yang dag dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: de yang de kho na ma nor ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ni yang dag dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the realization of the nature of reality, which is non-erroneous, is right view.

original: de nyid la tshul bzhin du rtog cing dpyod pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la tshul bzhin du rtog cing dpyod pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The proper investigation and examination of that is right thought.

original: de yang gzhan dag la ma nor ba'i rang bzhin du 'chad cing brdzun la sogs pa'i nyes bslangs pa'i tshig ni yang dag ba'i ngag go //üîΩde nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa spangs shing lus kyi las yongs su dag pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de yang gzhan dag la ma nor ba'i rang bzhin du 'chad cing brdzun la sogs pa'i nyes bslangs pa'i tshig ni yang dag ba'i ngag go // de nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa spangs shing lus kyi las yongs su dag pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Moreover, the speech which explains the nature of reality to others without error, and which is free from the faults of lying, etc., is right speech.üîΩThen, the abandonment of the faults of killing, etc., and the purification of bodily action is right action.

original: de nas tshul 'chos pa dang gzhogs slong la sogs pa log par 'tsho ba'i nyes ba spangs shing yongs su dag pa'i lus dang ngag gi las yongs su spyod pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'o //üîΩnyes pa lhag ma rnams spangs pa'i phyir mngon par spro ba ni yang @281a * //
analyzed: de nas tshul 'chos pa dang gzhogs slong la sogs pa log par 'tsho ba'i nyes ba spangs shing yongs su dag pa'i lus dang ngag gi las yongs su spyod pa ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'o // nyes pa lhag ma rnams spangs pa'i phyir mngon par spro ba ni yang @281a * //
translated: Then, the purification of livelihood, which is the complete avoidance of the faults of wrong livelihood, such as hypocrisy and flattery, is right livelihood.

original: dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i rtsol ba'o //
translated: The enthusiasm for the abandonment of the remaining faults is right effort.

original: de kho na nyid mi brjed pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mi brjed pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa'o //
translated: Right mindfulness is the nonforgetting of reality.

original: gong nas gong du yon tan gyi khyad par rnams mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to /
analyzed: gong nas gong du yon tan gyi khyad par rnams mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to /
translated: Right samadhi is the constant meditative equipoise on the special qualities of the higher levels in order to accomplish them.

original: lam la snyoms par zhugs pa las yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'byung na rgyu gang gis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: lam la snyoms par zhugs pa las yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa ji ltar 'byung na rgyu gang gis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do right view and so on occur in the path of meditation?

original: 'di la nges pa med de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs na rnal 'byor pa de lta bu'i so so rang gis rig pa'i de kho na myong bar yang 'gyur zhing gnas gyur par yang thob pa la /
analyzed: 'di la nges pa med de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs na rnal 'byor pa de lta bu'i so so rang gis rig pa'i de kho na myong bar yang 'gyur zhing gnas gyur par yang thob pa la /
translated: There is no certainty here, for when the yogi is in the transcendent path, he experiences the reality that is the object of individual knowledge and attains the transformation of the basis.

original: de las langs pa'i tshe na yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa la 'jug ste log pa'i ngag la sogs pa la ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs pa'i tshe na yang dag pa'i ngag la sogs pa la 'jug ste log pa'i ngag la sogs pa la ni mi 'jug go //
translated: When he rises from that, he engages in right speech and so on and does not engage in wrong speech and so on.

original: des na rgyu la 'bras bur btags te yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yan lag brgyad ni rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pas de lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na rgyu la 'bras bur btags te yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yan lag brgyad ni rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pas de lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the cause is designated as the result. The eight branches such as right view are the cause of purification, and therefore they are called the eight branches of the path.

original: de'i tshe na de'i tshig kyang mi smra la gos la sogs pa yang mi tshol bas de'i gnas skabs na yan lag brgyad mi 'byung ste 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na de'i tshig kyang mi smra la gos la sogs pa yang mi tshol bas de'i gnas skabs na yan lag brgyad mi 'byung ste 'gal ba'i phyir ro // de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: At that time, one does not speak, nor does one seek clothing and so on, and therefore the eight branches do not occur at that time, because they are incompatible.

original: des ji ltar myong ba'i de kho na nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: des ji ltar myong ba'i de kho na nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right view is the branch of complete discernment because it ascertains the reality that is experienced.

original: de ji ltar rtogs pa'i de kho na rnam par gzhag nas tshig tu 'don pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar rtogs pa'i de kho na rnam par gzhag nas tshig tu 'don pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Right thought is the branch that causes others to understand because it expresses the reality that is understood by means of verbal expression.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right speech, right action, and right livelihood are the branches that cause others to have confidence.

original: de dag go rims bzhin du rnal 'byor gyi lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang po byad bsnyungs pa rnam par dag pa gzhan yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du rnal 'byor gyi lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang po byad bsnyungs pa rnam par dag pa gzhan yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: The latter are, respectively, the view, morality, and austerity of the yogi.

original: 'dri ba'i lan yang dag par ldon pas yang dag pa'i ngag gi lta ba rnam par dag par yid ches so //
analyzed: 'dri ba'i lan yang dag par ldon pas yang dag pa'i ngag gi lta ba rnam par dag par yid ches so //
translated: One should believe in the purity of right speech, because one gives correct answers to questions.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par ro //
translated: One should believe in the purity of right action, because one does not do what should not be done.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas gos la sogs pa chos bzhin tshol bas yo byad bsnyungs par rnam par dag par ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas gos la sogs pa chos bzhin tshol bas yo byad bsnyungs par rnam par dag par ro //
translated: One should believe in the purity of austerity, because one seeks clothing, etc. in accordance with the Teaching, through right livelihood.

original: 'di dag ni go rims bzhin ngag dang lus dang / gnyis ka'i las kyi rang bzhin @281b no ;
analyzed: 'di dag ni go rims bzhin ngag dang lus dang / gnyis ka'i las kyi rang bzhin @281b no ;
translated: These are, respectively, the natures of the actions of speech, body, and both.

original: / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong bas sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong bas sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag go //
translated: Right effort is the member of complete purification, because it purifies the obscurations of both the disciples and the bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni bying ba dang rgod pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni bying ba dang rgod pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right mindfulness is the branch that purifies the obscurations of the mental afflictions of lethargy and excitement.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pas yang dag pa'i mtshan mar rtog pas bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pas yang dag pa'i mtshan mar rtog pas bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, through the foundations of mindfulness, one does not allow the opportunity for lethargy, excitement, etc. to occur by investigating the true characteristics.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan gyi khyad par mngon par bsgrub pa la sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan gyi khyad par mngon par bsgrub pa la sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right concentration is the branch that purifies the obscurations to the accomplishment of the special qualities.

original: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, through that, one accomplishes the special qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: ston par mdzad do zhes pa ni dbang po rnon pos mgo smos pas go ba dang / rtul pos shin tu rgyas pas kyang rtogs par dka' bas 'bring po'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston par mdzad do zhes pa ni dbang po rnon pos mgo smos pas go ba dang / rtul pos shin tu rgyas pas kyang rtogs par dka' bas 'bring po'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
